data.title: Delicious GF friendly place
data.text: After stopping at Cabo Winery, we were hungry for lunch! 2 Gals was only a block away.  I found it on my Find Me Gluten Free App! I was so glad we went! The restaurant is adorable. I enjoyed the decorations and atmosphere. The food was delicious! They had GF bread, wraps, and even the fries were safe! Everything was delicious. They have GF cupcakes on certain days. I did not try one, but I bet they are great. I will be back next time I'm in Concord!

data.title: Group Lunch
data.text: Our soccer team went to lunch here in between soccer games.  What a great choice!  The food, atmosphere and service was excellent.  I hope we find ourselves back in Concord sometime so I can eat here again!

data.title: Quick lunch
data.text: Went for lunch with wife and two year old. Friendly staff, easy menu. I had a tuna sandwich which was awesome. A mountain of tuna. She had a house salad with a cup of tuna atop. We enjoyed very much.

data.title: Home Made Food
data.text: I have been here 4 times now and it is just amazing...I love the food, the desserts are unbelievable and the service is excellent.......Price is also very reasonable for the amount of food you get.....They just started opening for dinner....Can;t wait to try it out!!

data.title: Awesome
data.text: The decor is very pleasing, with assorted table shapes and sizes covered with a variety of decorations both functional and just for fun. Walls decorations are unique too. Not eclectic, just homey. The beer and wine lists are ample. The selections are wide ranging with salads, wraps, burgers and the like, each item has  a unique spin. There are paleo choices as well. The sides include what they call "hearty" ones such as potato salad, an assortment of pastas and home made fries. Portions are generous and prices are very reasonable. Ice tea tastes freshly brewed. Then --- there are the desert choices which can be viewed through a large glass window with the bakery workspace behind them. Several very large unique muffin flavors were shown the day we were there. The service was very friendly and efficient. Everything is made to order so allow time to look at the decor. If you are nearby and the least bit hungry, stop here to experience a really great place. Congratulations to the 2 gals!!! We will be back.

data.title: delightful and different
data.text: If you are in the mood for some great food in a charming atmosphere this is the place for you!  The owners put together some fantastic meals.  I had the best burger I have had in a very long time here,  The food always tastes fresh and has a unique twist to it.

data.title: Friendly Place with Good Food
data.text: Nice place, perfect healthy food. Nice atmosphere with peek a boo window to incredible cupcakes. Staff is sweet. Good place for lunch or brunch.

data.title: Sandwiches and Cupcakes
data.text: 2 Gals is a great spot for lunch sandwiches and cupcakes.  We've never had anything bad.  The restaurant has an upscale feel in the dining room, but is comfortable enough for shorts and flip flops.

data.title: Excellent fresh food, fun casual atmosphere
data.text: Went here for a casual lunch. Food was excellent. Everything we had was great, I had a hamburger with the garlic spread. He has the chicken salad on bread (instead of the salad). We ordered brownies and cupcakes to go. They were so good. The restaurant has a very pretty decor. Really enjoyed our lunch.

data.title: If you desire healthy non fried food, really good food, look no further !!!
data.text: This gem of a restaurant is located in our own backyard in Concord NC.  So if you don't already know - its really really hard to find a place that serves veggies and other kinds of non fried food.  Well if your already on hwy 85 driving past Concord on your way to Charlotte for whatever ?!?  And your hungry, stop in, Their open from 11 to 3 PM Their meals will fill you up !!! You won't even think about supper.  Did i mention they have a separate baker on their premises that creates totally awesome cupcakes and such !  Their prices are very affordable for healthy veggie foodies and awesome sandwiches, Expect to pay around 10 bucks which is average.  I went with my girlfriend who is awesome but I'd go on my own too.  Not sure if they have  wifi, maybe not but your not there to spend time staring at your phone your there to eat good food. Their located across from the old courthouse in the old part of downtown Concord NC.  Enjoy, your tummy will thank you. -Mike

data.title: wonderful lunch
data.text: Great menu, delicious entree and side. Cupcakes and pastries over the top. I would go 2-3x week if I lived locally. Oh yea, service was friendly and efficient and Mary (one of the 2 gals) very cordial.

data.title: Small menu
data.text:
I did not know this place was open for dinner.  I thought it just catered to the courthouse crowd for lunch.  We noticed it was open for dinner so went in.  The menu had about 4 appetizers, four different choices for hamburgers and a few salads.  My wife went for the baked brie and I had the Tex-Mex spring rolls.  The brie was baked in a puff pastry and was served with sliced bread and fruit.  The spring rolls came with a very nice dip.  
The wait staff is outstanding.  They kept our water glasses full and checked in on us often.  It was a very nice experience that we hope to enjoy again soon.

data.title: Simply excellent
data.text: After spending several hours helping set-up for a wedding, we needed to grab lunch before going back to our hotel to get ready for the wedding. Based on a quick search on TripAdvisor, we chose 2 Gals. We were NOT disappointed. The wait staff was friendly, attentive and very sweet. There were so many incredible sounding options on the menu, we had trouble choosing. When the food arrived...wow. Everything is prepared using fresh ingredients, including all the house-made sauces and dressings. We couldn't stop talking about how delicious our meals were. While we didn't want to over-eat before the wedding, we couldn't resist ordering one of the in-house baked cupcakes (and what an amazing selection they had). We ordered the red velvet and split it four ways. Just enough for each of us to enjoy. It was moist and delicious; the icing was not too heavy or sweet. The perfect finish to a great meal. Would highly, highly recommend 2 Gals to anyone in the area.

data.title: Ahhmazing....from the food to the decor!!!
data.text: Everytime I come into town this quaint,warm, friendly restaurant is a must stop! The food is full of flavor, you can taste the passion the chef has in every entree to side dish. Highly recommend trying EVERYTHING, but if you're a burger buff as myself or soup connoisseur make those your top must try priorities. You will not be disappointed!

data.title: Cute decor & excellent food!
data.text:
Even though the place was relatively busy, my mom and I were sat quickly for lunch. We really admired the decor, especially! The exposed brick is adorable and so is the fact that you can look in on the sweet treats through the window. I love how eccentric and fun the place is. 

I love that they have local wine on their menu, which is what we ordered [and then proceeded to visit that winery afterwards]. The burgers really hit the spot, and everything was well-cooked, well-seasoned, and had great portion sizes. We realized at the end that we should have just split one order of baklava rather than each getting our own because we were both so full already! We brought it home for later, though, so it was worth it.

I would absolutely come back here again if I was in Concord, especially for a girls' lunch. Loved it!

data.title: Burgers, wow....!
data.text: Stopped for lunch after a workout visiting family and had possibly the best flavored burger I've ever had! Very good salad too.

data.title: Good food, good prices, nice setting
data.text:
On the way to a wedding in Concord, my wife and I had lunch at 2 Gals with our son and his wife. We weren't expecting much. We came away pleasantly surprised. 2 Gals is not "fine dining" - it's "comfortable dining", the kind of place I might go with my wife for dinner after church or on a week night. In that category, 2 Gals really excels.

Our plates were generous, but not overloaded. I had the "Jacked Up Burger", which features jalapeno jack cheese and a whole jalapeno pepper sliced lengthwise. Very tasty. One person had a turkey sandwich and another had a grilled chicken wrap, and surprisingly, the meat was not sliced as if from a deli - it was chunks of meat. The side dishes were well-prepared, not just afterthoughts as they are at so many places like this.

The decor is really interesting. The interior walls were brick at one time, then stucco was applied to the brick. Now some of the stucco has been strategically removed, leaving original brick showing here and there. There are lots of rather plain pendant lights hung from the high ceiling, resulting in an interesting effect. I would say 2 Gals is eclectic without being weird.

Service was quite good, and the price was amazingly reasonable. Two people can easily eat at 2 Gals for less than a meal at Panera Bread, for example.

If 2 Gals were in the town I live in, I'd be there for dinner a couple of times a month.

data.title: Try the soup!
data.text: Met my friend for lunch on a cold day in early February.   The place was crowded with downtown workers.   Go at 1:00 if you can, for more available seating.   The first time I ate at 2 Gals, she had 'Dill Pickle' soup on the menu.  Delicious!!  Fresh menu; always good and different items.

data.title: Incredible food!
data.text: Some of the best food I've ever had, burgers are incredible! Won't find a better restaraunt in a great atmosphere especially for the price!

data.title: His place was amazing
data.text: The bakery looked really good and my mother got a sandwich and I got soup it was So So dang good and it's a local business I would highly recommend
